required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multiple-Dose Pharmacokinetics Study of Three Gefapixant (AF-219/MK-7264) Formulations
clinical_study.official_title: A Study in Healthy Subjects to Assess the Multiple- Dose Pharmacokinetics of Three AF-219 Formulations

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the multiple dose pharmacokinetics (PK) of three gefapixant (AF-219) formulations; to assess the effect of Omeprazole on the multiple dose PK of three gefapixant formulations; and, to assess the safety and tolerability of gefapixant.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) profiles of three different oral formulations of gefapixant
primary_outcome.description: Plasma gefapixant concentration versus time profiles will be plotted for each subject; similar summary plots will be constructed for each treatment period. Plasma gefapixant PK parameters will be calculated using noncompartmental methods and summarized using descriptive statistics by each treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) profile of gefapixant following administration of Omeprazole
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) will be performed on log normal-transformed Cmax and AUC0-t values to determine the extent of a drug interaction, if any, of Omeprazole on the plasma gefapixant PK parameters

arm_group.description: Gefapixant oral tablets (15mg and 30 mg) administered twice daily for 15 days + Omeprazole oral capsules (20 mg or 40 mg) administered once or twice daily for 10 days

intervention.description: 20 mg oral capsules administered once daily for 10 days
40 mg oral capsules administered twice daily for 10 days
Gefapixant oral tablets (15 mg administered as two 7.5 mg tablets) administered twice daily for 15 days
Gefapixant oral tablets (30 mg administered as four 7.5 mg tablets) administered twice daily for 15 days
